definition: to add to the fun/to liven things up
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement

sentences.english: Meanwhile, two classmates danced by the seaside to entertain us.
sentences.chinese: 两个同学此时也开始在海边翩翩起舞给我们助兴。

sentences.english: The move sparked criticism, especially as the sport loves to glorify great games in snow.
sentences.chinese: 此举引发了批评，主要是雪喜欢给精彩的比赛助兴。

sentences.english: School brass band will provide music for entertainment.
This position gives both of you the opportunity to stoke each other for a little extra stimulation.
sentences.chinese: 这一体位能给你们双方不少额外刺激的助兴机会。

sentences.english: Street musicians have been gathering as part of the festival fringe.
sentences.chinese: 街头音乐人正聚集起来，为会演作助兴演出。

sentences.english: Drinkers' wager game is a kind of add to the fun games on the banquet.
sentences.chinese: 酒令，是酒席上的一种助兴游戏。

sentences.english: Later, the boy again christmas-to sing to us several song.
sentences.chinese: 随后，男生又助兴，为我们演唱了好几首歌。

definition: to perform music/to play a tune
to have a few drinks/to drink to one's heart's content
